Next Tweet from user karlbode ‏ Verified account @ KarlBode Feb 21 @ KarlBode @ KarlBode @ KarlBode @ KarlBode @ KarlBode Pending follow request from @ KarlBode Cancel your follow request to @ KarlBode Copy link to Tweet NEW from me: The White House this week released a report claiming that killing # netneutrality , privacy, and other broadband consumer protections created $50 billion in consumer benefits.
Telecom experts say the claims are complete and total nonsense.

vice.com/en_us/article/ xgq4xn/white-house-report-is-pure-propaganda-for-atandt-verizon-and-comcast … 11:45 AM - 21 Feb 2020 82 107 5 replies 82 retweets 107 likes 5 82 82 107 107 New conversation karlbode ‏ Verified account @ KarlBode Feb 21 Copy link to Tweet In the report, the Trump administration repeatedly tries to take credit for telecom "efficiencies" that either never happened or happened long before Trump was elected.
One researcher went so far as to call the White House report "pure propaganda."

3 replies 5 retweets 16 likes 3 5 5 16 16 Show this thread  karlbode ‏ Verified account @ KarlBode Feb 21 Copy link to Tweet Keep in mind that the FCC doesn't collect broadband pricing data, and its mapping data is notoriously unreliable.
So its sudden claim here that rubber stamping the whims of telecom giants produced $50 billion in "consumer welfare" is based largely on fluff and nonsense.

1 reply 3 retweets 16 likes 1 3 3 16 16 Show this thread  karlbode ‏ Verified account @ KarlBode Feb 21 Copy link to Tweet Oddly economists also aren't impressed by the White House's (false) claims that rubber stamping every fleeting whim of AT&T executives resulted in $50-$90 billion worth of consumer benefits: https:// twitter.com/HalSinger/stat us/1230971181248995329?s=19 … karlbode added, @ HalSinger Dear Council of Economic Advisors:  This is *not* how you do before/after analysis.

Sincerely,  An Obscure Economist  h/t @ KarlBode pic.twitter.com/gMOxpmZMwg Show this thread  2 replies 1 retweet 8 likes 2 1 1 8 8 Show this thread  End of conversation New conversation ‏ @ CPComm Feb 21 Copy link to Tweet Replying to @ KarlBode The "little guy" that elected MAGA against their own economic interest gets screwed again.
The disinformation campaign is keeping the base in line and the line will hold as long as Trump remains in office.

0 replies 0 retweets 2 likes 2 2 End of conversation poguemahon ‏ @ poguemahon Feb 21 Copy link to Tweet Replying to @ KarlBode Maybe it's just me and I mean this in a totally nonviolent and benevolent way, but whenever I see Ajit Pai I can't help but think that he's got an extremely punchable face.

This report is misleading about the so called positive effects of reducing consumer protections, even if it did that money is going to corporations.
